result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman Earl Rhodes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges.
To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to sentence now serving in 94CF1013B.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; also advised that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two.

records.addlTxt: AS TO EXHIBIT LIST for hearings held on 2-11-2016; 2-12-2016; 3-4-2016; and 3-28-2016.  Exhibit #15 was used twice by the state in marking exhibits.  Exhibit #15 is a photograph  and Exhibit #18 is the Firearms Certification that was entered on 3-28-2016.

Defendant Norman Earl Rhodes in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Defendant Norman Earl Rhodes in custody.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Prior to proceeding to sentencing, the court  placed on the record as to 4-24-2016 hearing:  The court adopted the state's findings of fact and conclusions of law based on the following criteria:  the defendant had no standing; the arrest made was lawful; the defendant had no expectation of privacy; and the state's witnesses were more credible.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties to the court.
As to count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to sentence now serving in 94CF1013B.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.
As to count 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, concurrent with count 2.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Norman Earl Rhodes in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Defendant Norman Earl Rhodes in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 3: Per negotiations and upon motion of the State, Count 3 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. 

AS TO COUNTS 2 and 4:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to both counts, and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 5/24/2016 at 8:15, branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 08:15 am.
